title: “There is Hardly a Book That Has Not Seen Hard Use”: Books for Working Artists
short_description: The Art Institute of Chicago has purchased artists’ manuals, treatises, and other publications for working artists since 1879. In July of 1909, the Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago reported that there had been more than 45,000 student visits to the library the previous year, “and there is hardly a book that has not seen hard use.”

input: “There is Hardly a Book That Has Not Seen Hard Use”: Books for Working Artists
